text: John William "Jake" Madden (11 June 1865 – 17 April 1948) was a Scottish footballer who played for Dumbarton, Gainsborough Trinity, Grimsby Town, Celtic, Dundee, Tottenham HotspurJohn Madden, 11v11.com and the Scotland national team.Dumbarton - People and Personalities John Madden, West Dunbartonshire Council At Celtic, where he played for eight years, he won the Scottish Cup in 1892 (also losing in two other finals, adding to a defeat with Dumbarton in 1887) and the Scottish Football League title in 1892–93, 1893–94 and 1895–96, playing a leading role in their establishment as one of the leading clubs in the country,(Celtic player) Madden, John, FitbaStats though he had been on the verge of leaving to join Sheffield Wednesday before professional contacts were officially introduced in Scottish football in 1893. He was capped twice by Scotland in 1893 and in 1895, both against Wales. He scored four times in an 8–0 win over Wales in March 1893. He also played for Dumbartonshire (3 caps / 4 goals), Glasgow (3 caps / 1 goal) and the Scottish Football League XI (4 caps / 2 goals).(SFL player) John Madden, London Hearts Supporters Club Between 1905 and 1930, Madden was the manager of SK Slavia Praha, and is considered an important figure in the development of the sport in the Bohemia region (at that time another Scot, Johnny Dick, was in charge of Slavia's city rivals Sparta).Madden and Dick, Scots Football Worldwide A stand at Slavia's Eden Arena is named after him, and each year a supporter group pays tribute at his grave in Prague, where he lived until his death.Scots footballer hailed for taking game to Europe, The Scotsman, 11 May 2015Tracing the footsteps of an ‘unknown’ Celtic hero – John William Madden, Gary McLaughlin, The Celtic Star, 13 February 2020 ==International goals== :Scores and results list Scotland's goal tally first. {| class="wikitable" ! # !!
